title: Virtual dependencies incorrectly affecting the hash
body:
@tgamblin @scheibelp @alalazo @davydden This is a really weird one that I've never seen before. 

From a fresh clone of Spack, with no `packages.yaml`, I'm seeing the following behavior. If I don't specify an MPI provider and let it pick up the default (`openmpi`), I see:
```
$ spack spec -L hdf5+mpi
...
tgprd6nwfgifpaff4a7dvcv3tynuaowd  hdf5@1.10.1%gcc@6.3.1+cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+pic+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
hj3i67mhesgu3x5ymwpj67m4nbq6d3c2      ^openmpi@2.1.1%gcc@6.3.1~cuda fabrics= ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple+vt arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
eva5cqpkbjggxvpp23ycr62yiocie64g          ^hwloc@1.11.7%gcc@6.3.1~cuda+libxml2+pci arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
reafmcemqbmvzqzyiitmyfcdc4ia7tzl              ^libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
4w4hvmepes4p75z37og3dn3gbzjpnwho                  ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
zcwwrrt7od3rrhxb5du2iybu65jlrlbw                      ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@6.3.1+sigsegv arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
625n6uiwuqes737tignpxu3snoibyc43                          ^libsigsegv@2.11%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
ywniw4sq7xd3fzz6c4c7jrhqj5htwobl                  ^pkg-config@0.29.2%gcc@6.3.1+internal_glib arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
lnv6kl5fucdneeh7h7ickta4vdis7u4v                  ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
ggtx25lpnfriqn4n35fsgquiug6uju7t              ^libxml2@2.9.4%gcc@6.3.1~python arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
yw6ju7g3kyc27eonzrrvu73cdpiy5hzq                  ^xz@5.2.3%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
jcukpuaeyykzu647duoufe2bdrgru5ko                  ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@6.3.1+pic+shared arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
```
If I do specify the MPI provider and explicitly tell it to use `openmpi`, I see:
```
$ spack spec -L hdf5+mpi^openmpi
...
ohnyu6ch2ewnkf2dnd32qrb6t2hlopgj  hdf5@1.10.1%gcc@6.3.1+cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+pic+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
yyiri5gxf7jtu2c3vrhj6on4wz3jf2jh      ^openmpi@2.1.1%gcc@6.3.1~cuda fabrics= ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple+vt arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
eva5cqpkbjggxvpp23ycr62yiocie64g          ^hwloc@1.11.7%gcc@6.3.1~cuda+libxml2+pci arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
reafmcemqbmvzqzyiitmyfcdc4ia7tzl              ^libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
4w4hvmepes4p75z37og3dn3gbzjpnwho                  ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
zcwwrrt7od3rrhxb5du2iybu65jlrlbw                      ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@6.3.1+sigsegv arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
625n6uiwuqes737tignpxu3snoibyc43                          ^libsigsegv@2.11%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
ywniw4sq7xd3fzz6c4c7jrhqj5htwobl                  ^pkg-config@0.29.2%gcc@6.3.1+internal_glib arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
lnv6kl5fucdneeh7h7ickta4vdis7u4v                  ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
ggtx25lpnfriqn4n35fsgquiug6uju7t              ^libxml2@2.9.4%gcc@6.3.1~python arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
yw6ju7g3kyc27eonzrrvu73cdpiy5hzq                  ^xz@5.2.3%gcc@6.3.1 arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
jcukpuaeyykzu647duoufe2bdrgru5ko                  ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@6.3.1+pic+shared arch=linux-fedora25-x86_64 
```
As you can see, the packages to be installed are identical. However, the hash for `openmpi` (and consequently `hdf5`) changed!
